item.title: Laura add a quote by Sara Gruen
item.description:
"I want her to melt into me, like butter on toast. I want to absorb her and walk around for the rest of my days with her encased in my skin.
I want." -- Sara Gruen

item.title: Laura add a quote by Sara Gruen
item.description: "I roll onto my side and stare out the venetian blinds at the blue sky beyond. After a few minutes I'm lulled into a sort of peace. The sky, the sky--same as it always was." -- Sara Gruen

item.title: Laura add a quote by Richard Yates
item.description: "He couldn't even tell whether he was angry or contrite, whether it was forgiveness he wanted or the power to forgive." -- Richard Yates

item.title: Laura add a quote by John Steinbeck
item.description: "But the Hebrew word, the word timshel—‘Thou mayest’— that gives a choice. It might be the most important word in the world. That says the way is open. That throws it right back on a man. For if ‘Thou mayest’—it is also true that ‘Thou mayest not." -- John Steinbeck

item.title: Laura add a quote by John Steinbeck
item.description: "I believe a strong woman may be stronger than a man, particularly if she happens to have love in her heart. I guess a loving woman is indestructible." -- John Steinbeck
